info.title: Scheduler
info.description: The Scheduler APIs let you programmatically interact with [Zoom Scheduler](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/zoom-scheduler/) features. They allow you to schedule, manage, and retrieve details about meetings, webinars, and other events on the Zoom platform. With powerful tools for integration, these APIs streamline event management and automate workflows in external applications.

get.description:
Returns the response submitted for a routing form.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read`,`scheduler:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read:routing`,`scheduler:read:routing:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: formId
parameters.description: The identifier of the routing form.

parameters.name: responseId
parameters.description: The identifier of the response to a particular routing form.

200.description: If succeeded, this method returns the routing response details in the response body. The response body will include basic routing form information, the questions in the form and the corresponding awnsers, and the final results after submitting the response, which could be one of the following: a URL, a text or a booking link.

booked.description: Indicating whether a final booking was made after submitting the response

booking_link.description: The booking link that the returned as the result of submitting the form. It could be empty because result type could be URL or text.

created_time.description: The time that the response was submitted.

questions_and_answers.description: The questions and answers in the response.

answers.description: This field could be text, email address, single choice or multiple choices, depending on questions types. All values are stored as string.

question_content.description: The question content asked in the form.

result_type.description: The type of result returned after submitting the response.

result_value.description: The value of result returned after submitting this response. Itcould be a booking schedule or a URL or a text.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rate-limits/).

500.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `500`
Internal Server Error InternalErr

get.description:
Generates the scheduler analytics report.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read`,`scheduler:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read:analytics`,`scheduler:read:analytics:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by start time. It must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset. For example, 2011-06-03T10:00:00-07:00, 2011-06-03T10:00:00Z. Milliseconds may be provided but are ignored. If `timeMin` is set, `timeMax` must be greater than `timeMin`.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The lower bound (exclusive) for an event's end time from which to filter. Optional. The default is not to filter by end time. It must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset, for example, 2011-06-03T10:00:00-07:00, 2011-06-03T10:00:00Z. Milliseconds can be provided but are ignored. If `timeMax` is set, `timeMin` must be smaller than `timeMax`.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: The time zone in the response. The default is the time zone of the calendar. Optional.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The specific user's web user ID. Default is "me". Use "all" to query for analytics with respect to all members under that account.

200.description: If successful, this method returns the scheduler analytics or the user ID or account ID provided.

items.description: The event name and its duration in minutes.

scheduled_events_created.description: The number of created scheduled events.

scheduled_events_completed.description: The number of completed scheduled events.

scheduled_events_canceled.description: The number of cancelled scheduled events.

scheduled_events_rescheduled.description: The number of rescheduled scheduled events.

one_to_one.description: The number of "one to one" type schedules.

any_host_available.description: The number of "any host available" type schedules.

all_host_available.description: The number of "all host available" type schedules.

meeting_poll.description: The number of "meeting poll" type schedules.

one_to_many.description: The number of "one to many" type schedules.

last_n_days.description: The stats of the last N days.

popular_schedules.description: The most popular schedules in the given time range.

items.description: The scheduled event's name and booked times.

popular_time_of_week.description: The distribution of number of events scheduled in a week.

popular_time_of_day.description: The distribution of number of events scheduled in a day.

scheduled_events_created.description: The number of created scheduled events.

scheduled_events_completed.description: The number of completed scheduled events.

scheduled_events_canceled.description: The number of cancelled scheduled events.

scheduled_events_rescheduled.description: The number of rescheduled scheduled events.

one_to_one.description: The number of "one to one" type schedules.

any_host_available.description: The number of "any host available" type schedules.

all_host_available.description: The number of "all host available" type schedules.

meeting_poll.description: The number of "meeting poll" type schedules.

one_to_many.description: The number of "one to many" type schedules.

previous_period.description: the stats of the previous period with a length of also N. Last N day is counting from today and backtrace N days. Previous period is counting from N days ago and back tracking another N days

users_with_least_events.description: The users with the least scheduled events.

items.description: The user's display name and number of scheduled events.

users_with_most_events.description: The users with the most scheduled events.

items.description: The user's display name and number of scheduled events.

get.description:
Returns the availability schedules of the given user.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read:admin`,`scheduler:read`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read:list_availability`,`scheduler:read:list_availability:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The maximum number of availability returned on one result page.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The token that specifies which result page to return.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The return of the specific user's availability.

200.description: Successful availability of the schedule query result of given user.

next_page_token.description: The token for a later to retrieve only the entries that have changed since this result was returned. It's omitted if further results are available, in which case `nextPageToken` is provided.

get.description:
Returns a list of all scheduled events.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read:admin`,`scheduler:read`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read:list_scheduled_events`,`scheduler:read:list_scheduled_events:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time from which to filter.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The lower bound (exclusive) for an event's end time from which to filter.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The maximum number of events returned on one result page.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: This field indicates the start time or the time when the event has been updated.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: The time zone in the response.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The token that specifies which result page to return.

parameters.name: show_deleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted events (with status equals `cancelled`) in the result.

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: Whether to return the pending events.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The return of the specific user's scheduled event. It's only for admin

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: This field returns search results from meeting ID or summary.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a response body with the following structure:

next_page_token.description: The token to access the next page of this result.

booker.description: Whether the attendee is the booker.

created.description: This field indicates when the attendee attended this event.

no_show.description: Whether to show events or not.

end_date_time.description: The scheduled event end date time.

location.description: The information for a custom location.

start_date_time.description: The scheduled event start date time.

status.description: The status of event: confirmed or cancelled.

updated.description: The moment the event was updated.

meeting_notes.description: The meeting notes of the event.

event_type.description: This field indicates the type is default(scheduled) or pending event.

external_location.description: The meeting details for when users have scheduled appointments.

kind.description: The type of meeting specified in the schedule.

meeting_id.description: The unique identifier of the meeting in string format.

personal_meeting_id.description: The personal meeting id in string format.

tracking_params.description: The information to track the source of invitee. This occurs when you add UTM parameters in schedule links.

key.description: The UTM parameters in the schedule links.

label.description: The scheduler tags that correspond to UTM parameters one by one.

value.description: The value of UTM parameters set in schedule links by host.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

500.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `500`
Internal Server Error **Error Code:** `500`
InternalErr

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: This field indicates whether the admin handles certain users. It's only for admin.

200.description: If successful, this method returns the scheduled event resource in the response body.

booker.description: Whether the attendee is the booker.

created.description: This field indicates when the attendee attended this event.

no_show.description: Whether or not to show the event.

end_date_time.description: The scheduled event's end date time.

location.description: The information for a custom location.

start_date_time.description: The scheduled event's start date time.

status.description: The status of event: confirmed or cancelled.

updated.description: The moment the event was updated.

meeting_notes.description: The meeting notes of the event.

event_type.description: This field indicates whether the type is default(scheduled) or a pending event.

external_location.description: The meeting details for when users have scheduled appointments.

kind.description: The type of meeting specified in the schedule.

meeting_id.description: The unique identifier of the meeting in string format.

personal_meeting_id.description: The personal meeting id in string format.

tracking_params.description: The information to track the source of invitee. Only use this setting you add UTM parameters in schedule links.

key.description: The UTM parameters in schedule links.

label.description: The scheduler tags that correspond to UTM parameters one by one.

value.description: The value of UTM parameters set in schedule links by host.

get.description:
Returns information about a specified attendee (person invited to an event).

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read`,`scheduler:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read:scheduled_event_attendee`,`scheduler:read:scheduled_event_attendee:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The ID of scheduled event.

parameters.name: attendeeId
parameters.description: The ID of attendee to get scheduled event attendee information.

200.description: If successful, this method returns the scheduled event attendee resource in the response body.

created.description: This field indicates when the attendee created this event.

no_show.description: Whether an attendee did not attend an event.

custom_values.description: The answer of the booking page questions.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `404`
NotFound

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rate-limits/).

500.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `500`
Internal Server Error **Error Code:** `500`

get.description:
Returns a list of all schedules.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read:admin`,`scheduler:read`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read:list_schedule`,`scheduler:read:list_schedule:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The upper bound (exclusive) for a schedule's start time from which to filter.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The lower bound (exclusive) for a schedule's end time from which to filter.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The maximum number of schedule results returned on a result page.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The token that specifies which result page to return.

parameters.name: show_deleted
parameters.description: Whether to include the deleted schedule (with status equals "cancelled") in the result.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: The time zone in the response.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The return of the specific user's schedules. Ths setting is only for admin.

200.description: If successful, this method returns a response body with this structure.

next_page_token.description: The token that accesses the next page of this result.

schedule_id.description: The unique identifier of the schedule.

add_on_type.description: The method of the type of `addOn`, such as Zoom meeting, Zoom phone, or offline.

availability_override.description: This field indicates the use of the availability rule.

availability_rules.description: The availability of the time rule.

availability_id.description: The ID of this availability rule.

email.description: The owner of this availability rule.

segments.description: The available time segments of the event.

start.description: The start date and time of the segment.

end.description: The end date and time of the segment.
The end time of this day.

start.description: The start time of this day.

end.description: The end time of this day.

start.description: The start time of this day.

end.description: The end time of this day.

start.description: The start time of this day.

end.description: The end time of this day.

start.description: The start time of this day.

end.description: The end time of this day.

start.description: The start time of this day.

end.description: The end time of this day.

start.description: The start time of this day.

end.description: The end time of this day.

start.description: The start time of this day.

segments_recurrence.description: The week of the available time rule.

time_zone.description: The timezone of this availability rule.

use_custom.description: This field indicates the use of custom availability instead of the rule.

booking_limit.description: This field sets the maximum events allowed per day.

after.description: This field adds the time before the booked schedule.

before.description: This field adds the time after the booked schedule.

buffer.description: This field indicates the extra time before or after the booked schedule.

capacity.description: This field indicates the maximum invitees per event.

color.description: The hexadecimal color value of the event type's scheduling page.

display_name.description: This field indicates the creator of the display name.

email.description: This field indicates the creator's email address.

self.description: This field indicates if you created the schedule. The field is read-only.

creator.description: The creator of the schedule. This field is read-only.

cushion.description: This field indicates the minimum time before a schedule starts when the attendees can book.

custom_fields.description: This field contains the custom question.

enabled.description: This field is true if the question the host creates is ON and visible on the event booking page. This field is false if it's OFF and invisible on the event booking page.

format.description: The type of response that the invitee provides to the custom question. It can be one or multiple lines of text, a phone number, or single- or multiple-select.[`string text phone_number single_select multi_select`]

include_other.description: This field is true if the custom question allows invitees to record a written response in addition to single-select or multiple-select type of responses. This field is false if the custom question does not allow invitees to record a written response.

items.description: The invitee's option for single_select or multi_select type of responses.

duration.description: This field indicates the duration of the meeting in minutes, range: [1, 1440].

post.description:
Creates a single-use scheduling link.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:write:admin`,`scheduler:write`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:write:single_use_link`,`scheduler:write:single_use_link:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

schedule_id.description: The unique identifier of a schedule.

201.description: If successful, this method returns a scheduling link URL in the response body.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `400`
invalidArgument

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

500.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `500`
Internal Server Error **Error Code:** `500`
internalErr

post.description:
Creates an endpoint for our Customize Once and Share feature. This API allows you to customize schedule for a specific attendee without needing to make an entirely new schedules.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:write`,`scheduler:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:write:share`,`scheduler:write:share:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

interval_type.description: The schedule time range. Unlimited means forever and fixed means using `startDate` and `endDate`.

get.description:
Returns information about the user.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read:admin`,`scheduler:read`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `scheduler:read:user`,`scheduler:read:user:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

200.description: If successful, this method returns user information in the response body.

slug.description: The portion of URL for the user's scheduling page where invitees book sessions that renders in a human-readable format.

scheduling_url.description: The URL of the users scheduling site where invitees book this event type.

picture.description: This field enables users to upload their personal avatars on Zoom.

logo.description: This field enables users to upload their company's logo on Zoom.

time_zone.description: The time zone to use when presenting time to the user.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `400`
invalidArgument

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `404`
notFound

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

500.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `500`
Internal Server Error **Error Code:** `500`
internalErr
